channel.title: Comments on: You need to have hardware virtualization enabled if you want to run Windows 8 in Virtual Box

item.description: i installed it on vmware player. i choose OS as 'other'. but the problem i couldn't accesses internet. no usb support. no vmware tools available

item.title: By: Dheeraj
item.dc:creator: Dheeraj
item.description: OK. GOOD NEWS GUYS. SPREAD THE WORD. The issue is resolved. For people who have enabled Virtualization in their BIOS, but still are getting the 0x00000 error, there is one and only one solution. I promise it works. Its a small edit in a file that you need to do. I can't disclose it here, people can email me at dheerajpoojari@yahoo.com for resolutions.<br />
item.content:encoded: OK. GOOD NEWS GUYS. SPREAD THE WORD. The issue is resolved. For people who have enabled Virtualization in their BIOS, but still are getting the 0x00000 error, there is one and only one solution. I promise it works. Its a small edit in a file that you need to do. I can’t disclose it here, people can email me at dheerajpoojari@yahoo.com for resolutions.

item.title: By: Dheeraj
item.dc:creator: Dheeraj
item.description: Hi All. I have tried all the mentioned steps above. Shutdown and rebooted several times, but still the error keeps popping up 0x000000<br /> Please Help
item.content:encoded:
Hi All. I have tried all the mentioned steps above. Shutdown and rebooted several times, but still the error keeps popping up 0x000000
Please Help

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
wundie ,

I had that issue initially….then I rebooted the virtual machine and it started to work

item.title: By: wundie
item.dc:creator: wundie
item.content:encoded:
Has anyone had an issue on Virtual Box where you’re only able to click on certain icons? For example, I can launch the control panel or desktop with a single click but when I try the IE tile it just moves and nothing happens. I can go to the desktop and launch IE without issue. Not sure what to try….

[Win7 x64 host running VB 4.1 attempting Windows Developer Preview with developer tools English, 64-bit (x64)]

item.title: By: Not working
item.dc:creator: Not working
item.description: @SQLDenis: You were right. Even though the intel utility sowed virtualization was enabled, it was Disabled in BIOS. Working after enabling that. Thanks!
item.content:encoded: @SQLDenis: You were right. Even though the intel utility sowed virtualization was enabled, it was Disabled in BIOS. Working after enabling that. Thanks!

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Not working…..All I did was enable VT in the BIOS, shutdown, restart and then did the 3 things in VirtualBox as described in this post and voila

I do want to point out that I picked windows 7 as the OS when creating this windows 8 virtual machine
